content.question: Which of the following functional differences between the rough and smooth endoplasmic reticulum <math alttext="open parenthesis, E R, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>ER</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> is explained by the structural differences between them?

choices.label: Rough <math alttext="E R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>ER</mtext></mrow></math> breaks down toxic substances, and smooth <math alttext="E R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>ER</mtext></mrow></math> only transports them out of the cell.

Rough <math alttext="E R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>ER</mtext></mrow></math> can synthesize and package lipids for export, and smooth <math alttext="E R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>ER</mtext></mrow></math> cannot.

Rough <math alttext="E R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>ER</mtext></mrow></math> can produce <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and smooth <math alttext="E R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>ER</mtext></mrow></math> cannot.

Rough <math alttext="E R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>ER</mtext></mrow></math> can synthesize and package proteins for export, and smooth <math alttext="E R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>ER</mtext></mrow></math> cannot.

content.answer: Rough <math alttext="E R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>ER</mtext></mrow></math> can synthesize and package proteins for export, and smooth <math alttext="E R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>ER</mtext></mrow></math> cannot.
